Description: Lower body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, probably with everted rim; interior: broad band flanked by sets of dilute lines; exterior glazed black; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: The lack of a body and rim prevents a definitive identification of the cup as a South Ionian cup with everted rim, the interior decoration finds parallels with Schlotzhauer’s (Schlotzhauer 2012) South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.607) (Phase 3)
